author: Special Correspondent
text:
An awareness programme on saving girl children will be held at Agra on January 14 in which youth from different parts of the country will participate.

Organised by Adolescent Health Committee of Federation of Obstetric and Gynaecological Societies of India (FOGSI) in coordination with the All India Conference of Obstetrics and Gynaecology besides the Nagercoil and Agra units of the society, the programme aims at sensitising the youth to the importance of protecting the rights of girls. Addressing the media here on Thursday, A. Charmila, national co-ordinator of the society, said a total of 37 young women from Tamil Nadu would participate in the rally. A majority of participants were from the Department of Women’s Studies of Bharathidasan University.

The volunteers would carry National Flag, FOGSI flag and a torch from Kanyakumari and hand over the same to the organisers at Agra. Similar groups of youths will come from different directions across the country and converge at Agra. Called ‘youth rally from Kanyakumari to Agra’, it aims at inculcating the principles of national integration, team spirit and popularising the principles and programmes of FOGSI and AICOG, according to Jayam Kannan, chairperson of the organising committee.
title: Awareness programme on saving girl children to be held at Agra on January 14
